Text: Forgot to mention in the description...I am in the process of ripping the entire series (seasons 1-10) in high quality for myself.  If there is an interest in this torrent, I will continue to post the rest of the seasons as they are finished.  If you enjoy the quality, please leave a comment that others may find useful.  Thanks...enjoy!!
Very good quality indeed ! Nice work.

I was wondering though: Do you use any desinterlacing filter for some episodes ? For example, in the 1x06, we can see artefacts resulting of a non desinterlaced video encoded in progressiv way (ex: 38'11''-13''). Or does it come with the DVD already?

Hmm...the video is run through a decombing filter.  That type of filter basically deinterlaces only when needed.  For instance, if you deinterlaced an entire video that was only interlaced at some parts, it would look horrible.  The decombing filter solves that problem by being a "smart" filter and only deinterlacing portions that are interlaced.  It is safe to just leave the filter on for any encode since it will only kick in when needed.  Now there are settings on the filter that can be tweaked for sensitivity.  However, I like what the defaults produce.  To be honest, I couldn't notice any interlacing artifacts at the spot you referenced.  However, you may have more of a trained eye. I've finished watching the first season and part of the 2nd (I just found this series myself), and haven't noticed any artifacts that have detracted from the viewing experience.  But I don't doubt that there could be minor flaws here or there.  Some does have to do with the quality of the original dvds.  Thanks for commenting ( :

evilminded:
You are totally right!  Good catch.  I don't know how I missed that.  I assumed somehow that they were 5.1 channel.  They are in fact Dolby Digital 2.0.  It is still the AC3 original audio from the dvds.  However, it looks like season 1 only offered the Dolby Digital.  It looks like the dvds for the rest of the seasons do have 5.1...so that should be correct for the rest of the torrents.  I have updated the description accordingly.  Thanks!

The quality has absolutely nothing whatsoever to do with the processor you are using. I could do exactly the same rip using my backup machine (a 3.2G HT Pentium 4 from 2004). EXACTLY the same rip. The only difference would be in how long it would take, but that doesn't mean anything to anyone who would download it from me. And since Season 1 was filmed in 16mm, the file size here is excessive (especially for h.264). The other seasons (35MM and later digital HD) are fine, and I do appreciate the effort, but don't speak about technical issues that are beyond your understanding. It's embarrassing.

Wetmouse:
I think you misunderstand.  The whole point of my explanation was exactly what your conclusion was.  The entire point is that the more powerful processor can handle the higher settings in a reasonable time.  If it took you 20 hours an episode on your p4 to do a 2-pass rip at the settings that were used for these, it would take you close to 3 weeks at a minimum to release one season.  Sure, you could do exactly the same rip...but where are those rips?  Are they out there...probably not, because most people won't devote the amount of time it would take to release a 10 season series that way.  If you understand how h.264 works, then you know that there are algorithms available that help pack in more quality into smaller files.  So take for example those 700mb rips that are out there.  Very nice quality.  However, looking at their quality, I believe my 600mb rips are at a higher quality, because I was able to turn up the high settings, enabling the proper algorithms that, yes - take a ton of processing power (i.e. time), but pack in more quality into a smaller file size.  So this is indeed beneficial to the downloader...thus why I even mention this.

I don't understand why your embarrassed...unless you just realized that your comment added absolutely nothing positive or helpful to the internet, piratebay, or this torrent.

Oh and also...the "other digital HD" seasons that you say are fine...are not HD, by the way.  Seasons 7-10 were broadcasted in HD on some stations, but there are no HD/720p releases on dvd media.  Nor will you find any torrents of them.  These are simply high quality dvd rips.  That is quite a compliment to compare the high quality dvd rips to digital HD.  THanks.

File sizes seem far too large for a dvd-rip. h.264 is more efficient than xvid, so you should be able to get near perfect sd dvd rips in far, far smaller file sizes. I have seen 100-150mb tv ep dvd rips that looked near perfect, and it taxes your HD space a lot less :)

Of course there is no problem with a super HQ torrent like this, if someone wants max quality and doesnt care about hd space, then this is what they need.

I however am looking for great quality but very efficient x264 rips of everything stargate. So far RiddlerA is one of the few peeps posting those but he has little scifi stuff :(
